result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th) and OWI (5th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th) and the other charge, OWI (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gerald M Erpelding was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).
  • Gerald M Erpelding was found guilty of Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.

Defendant Gerald M Erpelding in court with attorney David J.W. Klauser. Prosecuting Atty Lanny B Glinberg appeared for State of Wisconsin. Prel hrg held. FBPD Off Lucas Hale sworn & testified. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2,500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court.
